title: Council’s Last Stand
outcome: The weakened Directorate launches one last push to retake control by flooding the city with propaganda. Instead of violence, citizens answer with coordinated, peaceful demonstrations and public readings of Halden’s last warnings. Council authority is finally stripped as the population ushers in a new era of non-centralized governance.

events.description: Directorate officials issue citywide orders to broadcast dramatic warnings about disorder and chaos, attempting to reignite fear and support for central authority.
Citizens respond with nonviolent resistance: silent street gatherings, public storytelling, and mass music events inspired by Halden’s old warnings.
Crowds peacefully surround the Council’s headquarters, reading aloud testimonies of BCI abuses and the harm inflicted by years of algorithmic control.
The last officials are peacefully escorted from office. The city officially dissolves the Council and Directorate, replacing them with open citizens’ assemblies.
